SEARCH

Package server

package server
Provides HTTP server functionality and request parsing utilities.

This package contains the core components for building a multi-threaded HTTP server that can handle concurrent requests and route them to appropriate servlets based on HTTP methods and URI patterns.

Key Components:

HTTPServer
Interface defining the contract for HTTP server implementations
MyHTTPServer
Concrete implementation of HTTPServer with thread pool support and servlet routing
RequestParser
Utility class for parsing HTTP requests and extracting request components
RequestParser.RequestInfo
Data class encapsulating parsed HTTP request information

Usage Example:

 
 // Create and configure server
 HTTPServer server = new MyHTTPServer(8080, 10);
 server.addServlet("GET", "/api", new ApiServlet());
 server.addServlet("POST", "/upload", new UploadServlet());
 
 // Start server
 server.start();
 
 // ... handle requests ...
 
 // Shutdown server
 server.close();

Thread Safety:

All classes in this package are designed to be thread-safe for concurrent use. The MyHTTPServer uses a thread pool to handle multiple requests simultaneously while maintaining thread safety through proper synchronization.

Request Flow:

  1. Client connects to server
  2. RequestParser parses the HTTP request
  3. Server matches URI to registered servlet using longest-prefix matching
  4. Request is delegated to appropriate servlet for processing
  5. Response is sent back to client
  6. Connection is closed
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Almog Sharoni Yuval Harary
  • Class
    Description
    HTTPServer
    HTTPServer interface defines the contract for HTTP server implementations.
    MyHTTPServer
    MyHTTPServer is a concrete implementation of the HTTPServer interface.
    RequestParser
    RequestParser is a utility class for parsing HTTP requests from client connections.
    RequestParser.RequestInfo
    RequestInfo is an immutable data class that encapsulates all components of a parsed HTTP request.
